original: JOHANSSON, Karl Albin Abraham, Direktör, Stockholm, f Sthlm 11/2 86 av verkm C J J o Augusta Nilsdtr, gm Linnea Carlsson. Folksk, e. elev v HHS 12, stud i Tyskl 13. Springpojke, bitr, hdlsres o hdlsförest 00—06, förest f KF :s soliditetsavd samt kont.chef 07—15, aff.ch i Konsum Sthlm 15—17, kassach 1 KF 18, aff.chef 20 o vkst dir 24. Styr.-suppl KF 14—17, ord 18, styr.ordf i KF o dess dtrföret 24, styr.led Konsum Sthlm 15— 17, int koop alliansen 19, int koop prtihdlsfrn sed. start 20, v. styr.ordf Nord Aandelsfor-bund sed. start 18, ordf där 32 o i försäkr.-anst Samarbete 20—25. Rev i Spånga kommun 07—08, styr.led i Sthlms frihamnsAB 25, i AB Sv tobaksmonop 31, jvgsflm 26, led av Sthlms stads hdls- o sjöf.nmd 20, styr.ordf i Kgl teat 33—40, led av 36 års när.org.sakk, ind.sakk 39, ind.kommiss :s råd 39, IVA 36, konj.inst 37, ordf Sv uppfinnarefrn 40. Resor: Tyskl, Schweiz, Ital, Belg o Holl 11, däreft europ länd o USA uppr ggr. RNO, S :t Eriks-M, HazeliusM; medl Nat.ekon frn, Rotary, Sthlms-Gillet. °JOHANSSON, Anders Fredrik, Fabrikör, Kristinehamn, f Visnums-Kil, Värml l, 3/1 80 av hemm.äg J Johnsson o Maria Olsdtr, gm Gerda Johansson. Inneh Kristinehamns Spisbrödsfabrik. Styr.led i Värml Ensk Bks avd.kont sed. 23. Ldstingsman fr 26, led av dirrn f ldst:s sjukv.inrättningar fr 29, stdsflm fr19, led av drätselk fr 19, ordf å dess 3:e avd fr 25, v. ordf i belysn.styr fr 28, ordf i arb.-lösh.komm 25—27, Kristinehamns Mejerifrn fr 33 o Värml Mejerifrb fr 35.
translated: JOHANSSON, Karl Albin Abraham, Director, Stockholm, b. Sthlm 11/2 86, son of C J J and Augusta Nilsdtr, married to Linnea Carlsson. Primary school, former student at HHS 12, studied in Germany 13. Errand boy, assistant, sales representative and sales manager 00-06, manager of KF's solvency department and head of finance 07-15, business manager at Konsum Stockholm 15-17, cashier at 1 KF 18, business manager 20 and deputy CEO 24. Board member substitute at KF 14-17, regular member 18, chairman of the board at KF and its subsidiary companies 24, board member at Konsum Stockholm 15-17, member of the cooperative alliance 19, member of the cooperative retail trade since its inception in 20, vice chairman of Nord Aandelsfor-bund since its inception in 18, chairman since 32 and of the insurance company Samarbete 20-25. Auditor in Spånga municipality 07-08, board member of Sthlms FrihamnsAB 25, of AB Sv tobaksmonop 31, film industry 26, member of Sthlms stads hdls- and sjöf.nmd 20, chairman of Kgl teat 33-40, member of the 36 års när.org.sakk, industrial expert 39, industrial commissioner's council 39, IVA 36, economic institute 37, chairman of the Swedish inventors' association 40. Travel: Germany, Switzerland, Italy, Belgium, and the Netherlands 11, afterwards to various European countries and the USA multiple times. Order of the North Star, Order of St. Erik, Hazelius Medal; member of the National Economics Association, Rotary, Sthlms-Gillet. °JOHANSSON, Anders Fredrik, Manufacturer, Kristinehamn, b. Visnums-Kil, Värml l, 3/1 80, son of J Johnsson and Maria Olsdtr, married to Gerda Johansson. Owner of Kristinehamns Spisbrödsfabrik. Board member of Värml Ensk Bks avd.kont since 23. Member of the county council from 26, board member of the board of directors of the county's medical institutions from 29, mayor from 19, member of the local government since 19, chairman of its 3rd division from 25, vice chairman of the lighting committee from 28, chairman of the unemployment committee 25-27, Kristinehamns Mejerifrn from 33 and Värml Mejerifrb from 35.

structured.name: Karl Albin Abraham Johansson
structured.description: Johan Karl Albin Abraham Johansson was born on February 11, 1886 in Stockholm. He was the son of C J J and Augusta Nilsdtr. He married Linnea Carlsson. Johansson attended primary school and then became a former student at HHS, graduating in 1912. He also studied in Germany in 1913. Johansson worked as an errand boy, assistant, sales representative, and sales manager from 1900 to 1906. From 1907 to 1915, he served as the manager of KF's solvency department and later became the head of finance. In the years 1915 to 1917, he worked as the business manager at Konsum Stockholm. In 1918, he became a cashier at 1 KF, and from 1920 onwards, he served as the business manager and later the deputy CEO. Johansson held various positions on the boards of KF, Konsum Sthlm, Nord Aandelsfor-bund, and other organizations. He also held roles such as chairman of Kgl teat and the insurance company Samarbete. Johansson was active in multiple industries and had interests in theater, economics, and inventing. He traveled extensively throughout Europe, including Germany, Switzerland, Italy, Belgium, and the Netherlands. He also visited the United States multiple times. Johansson received honors such as the Order of the North Star, Order of St. Erik, and Hazelius Medal. He was a member of the National Economics Association, Rotary, and Sthlms-Gillet.
